attributes.action: limit the number of international students in the UK
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Up to 50,000 UK students have been denied places at British universities this year while the number of non-European students given places has doubled over the last ten years.

According to the report, in 2007/08 some 229,640 students came from outside the European Union, compared with 117,290 in 1998/99. Students from China remained the “most significant” number.

Most universities in the country prefer international applicants who pay more than double the fees that British Students pay.

Therefore we petition the prime minister to cap the number of international students allowed into British universities and ensure British students are given priority.
